title: Glenn.Gould.Collection.Vol.I.AVC.AC3.720p
description:
Somehow or other, I managed to obtain a DVD RIP of a mishmash of video recordings of Glenn Gould from about 1960 onwards (ie. some in black and white, some color). The DVD itself contains interviews and news clips, all spoken in English but (sadly) all overdubbed in German. Even Glenn Gould himself could not get a sentence in edgewise.

A few words of his did manage to get through, but only enough to tease the viewer, and better left forgotten. 

Strangely the German voice chosen to replace Gould's reminded me of a truck driver I once met while hitchhiking across Europe WAY back in the day when that sort of thing was actually encouraged. The Belgian driver spoke loudly and slovenly as he and I (apparently) departed from a night club leaning one against another as the two of us were WAY TOO DRUNK to walk.

And then to my utter surprise (this I do remember) next thing I knew, and against all odds, my Belgian truck driver friend managed and proceeded to insert the key into the ignition and then drive an 18-wheel tractor-trailer (me with it!) right onto the ferry at Calais, given about a 6 inch margin of error on the spiral-shaped ramp!
    
He parked the truck with surgical precision in the lower deck of the ferry and then (with me tagging along) found a secret room where his lower (and my upper) birth awaited, free of charge, before the ferry commenced crossing the English Channel where, once ashore, (6 hours later) we continued on to London Ã¢â‚¬Â¦

Ã¢â‚¬Â¦ still drunk.

I ask again: Can't they read?

--------------------------------------

Anyway, here's one of the successes, both in audio and video. A result not yet reproduced for any of the other performances on the DVD (yet). 

This would be track #2 in the collection as indicated (I will add more). The quality is about as good as I think it would have been on the original television studio recordings.
